paragraphs: Earlier today, Bella Hadid took to Instagram to share her latest show-stopping outfit—one that fit perfectly with the grunge-inflected look the model has been leaning into recently. Striking a pose in a corner of her New York City apartment, Hadid paired a sleeveless plaid shirt with a leather vest that featured a heart-shaped cutout at the back, along with a snugly-fitting pair of flared black trousers and a ’90s-inspired square leather shoulder bag.

For those looking closer, however, the shot also provided a rare glimpse of Hadid’s eclectic approach to home decor, from her retro shelving unit to the colorful Keith Haring poster that hung above it. Eagle-eyed fans might also have spotted the cult homewares line Hadid is clearly a fan of, with no less than four of Areaware’s hit Totem candles placed across her shelves.

With their quirky indentations and variety of colorways, the candles are popular not just for the soothing ambiance they create when lit, but also for their ability to exist as small sculptural objects around the home. And the best thing? Coming in three sizes that range between $12 and $20, they won’t break the bank. She might be one of the world’s highest-earning models, but Hadid clearly knows a bargain when she sees one, too.
